sentences.en: Christmas is a time of gaiety.
He was dazzled by the gaiety and splendour of the metropolis.
sentences.cn: 大都市的花花世界使他感到眼花缭乱.

sentences.en: Her manner professed a gaiety that she did not feel.
sentences.cn: 她的神态显出一种她并未实际感受到的快乐.

sentences.en: Lars enjoyed the warmth and gaiety of these occasions.
sentences.cn: 拉斯喜欢这类场合温馨而欢乐的气氛。

sentences.en: Music rang out adding to the gaiety and life of the market.
sentences.cn: 音乐响起来了，给市场增添了一份快乐和生机。

sentences.en: Paris had an air of gaiety.
sentences.cn: 巴黎是一片欢乐的气象.

sentences.en: Pearl was decked out with airy gaiety.
sentences.cn: 她把珠儿打扮得花枝招展.

sentences.en: She brought him a sense of fun, of gaiety that filled a gap in his life.
sentences.cn: 她带给他开心快乐，弥补了他生命中的缺憾。

sentences.en: She felt, without knowing why, that the gaiety was assumed.
sentences.cn: 不知为什么她觉得这种快乐是装出来的.

sentences.en: Smiles, nods, and cheerful faces added to the general gaiety.
sentences.cn: 微笑、点头和喜洋洋的脸庞使喜庆的气氛变得更浓了。

sentences.en: The colourful flags added to the gaiety of the occasion.
sentences.cn: 彩旗增添了盛会的欢乐气氛。

sentences.en: The colourful flags added to the gaiety of the occasion.
sentences.cn: 彩旗给这次盛会增添了欢乐的气氛.

sentences.en: The Gaiety is reviving John B. Kean's comedy "The Man from Clare".
sentences.cn: 盖伊提剧院正在重新上演约翰·B.基恩的喜剧《来自克莱尔的人》。

sentences.en: The tension has by contrast an almost extravagant gaiety.
sentences.cn: 这种紧张恰恰相反则隐含着某种无度的狂欢纵乐.

sentences.en: Too much gaiety or laughter would jar upon their almost sacred quiet.
sentences.cn: 过多的欢乐和嬉笑都会干扰她们那几乎神圣肃穆的宁静.

sentences.en: We all immersed in the gaiety of the Spring Festival.
sentences.cn: 我们都沉浸在春节的欢乐之中。

words.tran_cn: 快乐，兴高采烈；庆祝活动，喜庆；（服饰）华丽，艳丽

trans.tran_en: when someone or something is cheerful and fun
